data.title: Integrated Behavioral Health
data.meta_description: 7101 US-90 Ste 103 Daphne, AL 36526 Phone: 855-422-1618 Medical Records: 256-325-1890 Fax: 251-517-5801 Mon-Fri 8am-5pm Our Physicians Modal Title Modal Title Our Nurse Practitioners Modal Title Our Therapists Modal Title Modal Title Modal Title Our Team Modal Title
data.text:
Daphne & Fairhope Clinic: Monday-Friday

Dr. Cantwell has been a psychiatrist for over 30 years. He is dual Board Certified in Adult and Child/Adolescent Psychiatry, received his medical degree from the University of Michigan in 1987, and completed his residency and fellowship training at the University of Florida in 1992. Dr. Cantwell has served as full-time medical school faculty at the University of Virginia and the University of Colorado, and as Medical Director at several psychiatric facilities in Colorado, before opening his first private practice in Mt. Pleasant, SC in 2006. Dr. Cantwell joined Alabama Psychiatric Services (APS) in 2008, and worked there until 2015, when he joined Comprehensive MedPsych Systems in Fairhope after APS closed. In 2017, Dr. Cantwell opened his solo private practice in Fairhope, Cantwell Family Psychiatry (CFP), and sold CFP in 2023 to Integrated Behavioral Health (IBH). He is thrilled to continue serving his established patients as well as new patients at the IBH office in Fairhope since August 2023, before moving to our permanent location in Daphne in late 2023. As a Christian, Dr. Cantwell provides quality care and has a compassionate, collaborative, and respectful approach to addressing the medical, biopsychosocial and spiritual needs of patients and their families of all ages.

Dr. Cantwell provides comprehensive outpatient evaluations and treatment to patients of all ages in the context of their families whenever possible and clinically appropriate. Dr. Cantwell provides competent and compassionate care in treating the most common psychiatric disorders throughout the life spectrum. His clinical interests include: Mood disorders such as Major Depression and Bipolar Disorders; Anxiety Disorders such as Generalized Anxiety, Social Anxiety, Post Traumatic Stress, Panic and Obsessive-Compulsive Disorders; Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorders; Learning Disabilities and Behavior Disorders; Autistic Spectrum Disorders; Sleep Disorders; Eating Disorders; Substance Abuse; Dementias in consultation with Neurologists; Psychotic Disorders; Grief and Loss associated with the death of a loved one, divorce, family conflict, unemployment and suicide; and collaboration with Primary Care and other Specialists regarding the impact of mental issues on patients’ physical health. Dr. Cantwell prefers to have patients engaged in psychotherapy with counselors and psychologists whenever possible and collaborates with these other mental health professionals, as well as refers patients for psychological and neuropsychological testing when indicated.

Dr. Rogers is an adult psychiatrist with a passion for serving the South Alabama community with high quality and compassionate care. He graduated with his Bachelor’s of Science from the University of South Alabama in 2015 where he was a member of their football team. Dr. Rogers earned his medical degree from the Alabama College of Osteopathic Medicine in 2019 and returned to the University of South Alabama to complete his psychiatric residency. He was trained in a variety of settings, disorders, and treatment methods. Some of his specializations include substance use disorders, alternative treatments for treatment resistant depression, dementia, anxiety, PTSD, OCD, and ADHD. Due to his background as a college athlete, he has a passion for helping fellow athletes navigate their mental health obstacles by serving as the treating psychiatrist for a local D1 athletic program. He is excited to join the IBH team to serve the mental health needs of his local community!

Daphne Clinic: Monday-Friday

John is a 2014 graduate of Tennessee State University where he received his Master of Social Work degree. His graduate school internships gave him the opportunity to work with diverse client groups. Since graduation, John has worked in multiple mental health settings from corrections to adult inpatient hospitalization where he worked with clients being treated for anxiety, depression, grief, trauma, personality disorders and other chronic mental health concerns. He is also experienced in crisis intervention, de-escalation, and suicide prevention. John has a passion for working with the LGBTQ community and previously completed a graduate internship at Nashville CARES where he became an advocate for those living with HIV/AIDS.

John has therapeutic training in Cognitive Behavioral Therapy, Dialectical Behavioral Therapy, Solution Focused Therapy and Motivational Interviewing. In 2022, he also became trained in EMDR through EMDR Consulting. John is licensed as a clinical social worker by the Alabama Board of Social Work Examiners and the Tennessee Board of Social Work.

John moved to Alabama with his spouse in 2022 and is proud to call the city of Mobile his home. In his free time, he enjoys trying new restaurants, trips to the beach, gardening and spending time outdoors. He is also the proud parent of several special needs fur babies.

Daphne Clinic: Monday-Friday

Daphne Clinic: Monday – Friday

Sarah is a Licensed Clinical Social Worker in both Alabama and Oklahoma. She received a Bachelor in Social Work at Southwestern Oklahoma State University in 2012, and a Master in Social Work at the University of Oklahoma in 2014. Sarah has a vast experience in working with many different social work setting including both direct practice and administrative and community practice. As a therapist, Sarah has training in CBT, Team-CBT, CBT-S, DBT, TF-CBT, and advanced MI. Her specialties include working with sexual abuse and domestic violence survivors, as well as anxiety, depression, crisis care, and personality disorders. Sarah has worked in outpatient, inpatient, and school based settings. She also has experience in grant writing, hospice, and prison settings. Sarah believes that it is an absolute privilege to be able to witness the journey of her clients as they become heroes of their own story.

Daphne Clinic: Monday – Friday
